diff_act: 2.customize reports by adding relevant bridge and project data
3.integrate current selections with previous reports or external data sources
4.integrate PDF and other file formats as attachments or embedded objects into reports

generation1: #step1: Step 1: analyze and extract function points\nThe extracted fine-grained function points: 1.view various data. 2.support report creation and review. 3.support integration including incorporating PDF files and integration of selections. 4.save reports in different formats.

#step2: Step 2: locate the incompleteness\nThe spec 1 allows selection and execution of predefined reports related to various data which addresses function point 1. The spec 2 supports report creation and review using tools other than InfoMaker which addresses function point 2. Specs 3 and 4 discuss integrating selections and saving in various formats which cover parts of function points 3 and 4. \nAt first glance, it appears all function points are potentially covered, pointing towards a S2 (implied absence).

#step3: Step 3: Detect the specific incompleteness\nSince the incompleteness belongs to S2, we proceed with step 3.2. Reviewing specifications doesnâ€™t reveal any unconsidered conditions, so we look to operation sequence for new insights. \nAnalyzing operation sequence, item 4 (integrate PDF and other file formats) appears central. Although spec 3 mentions integration, it doesn't specify integrating PDF which suggests a potential action incompleteness regarding specifics of PDF integration.

regen.absent_element: integration of PDF and other file formats as attachments or embedded objects into reports
regen.new_specification: The system shall enable the integration of PDF and other file formats as attachments or embedded objects into reports, ensuring these files are viewable and functional within the report context.
